wikipedia_page.main: Charles Clarke (11 April 1878 – unknown) was a Scottish cricketer active from 1902 to 1905 who played for Sussex and Lancashire. He was born in Partick. He appeared in four first-class matches as a lefthanded batsman who bowled left arm medium pace. He scored seventeen runs with a highest score of 10 and took one wicket.

response: Charles Clarke (born 1950) is a former British Member of Parliament.
Charles Clarke may also refer to:
*Charles Clarke (judge) (died 1750), English barrister, judge and politician
*Charles Clarke (Canadian politician) (1826–1909), speaker of the Legislative Assembly of Ontario, Canada
*Charles Clarke (RAF officer) (1923–2019), British RAF officer and Great Escape lookout
*Sir Charles Clarke, 3rd Baronet (1839–1932), Quartermaster-General to the Forces
